main event: A highway patrolman observed a long silvery shaped object resembling a large star with a trail like a meteor on February 5, 1964.
interesting points: The object was observed for 4 seconds before it disappeared at the horizon,The patrolman initially believed it to be a meteor sighting,The sighting occurred at 45 degrees azimuth and 73 degrees elevation,The event was reported from a vehicle within the city limits of Corvallis, Oregon,The report did not provide any information suggesting it was not a meteor.
sighted object: long silvery shaped object resembling a large star
witness description: highway patrolman for the Oregon State Police
